Description: Handle of Rhodian pottery transport amphora; handle at neck join to sharpish turn. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Warrington Museum & Art Gallery. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p.31, 53. Name Xenophanes. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, BIBALEX 0181.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0865)
